meanings.definition: A Communist party official responsible for political education and organization.
meanings.sent1: The commissars led the political education sessions for the party members.
meanings.sent2: The commissars were in charge of organizing the party's activities.
meanings.sent3: The commissars decided to have a dance-off for political education - it was quite entertaining!
meanings.sent4: The commissars were the guiding stars in the dark sky of political organization.
meanings.sent5: The commissars' dedication to political education shone brightly among the party members.

meanings.definition: A member of a Communist party who is in charge of political education and organization.
meanings.sent1: Every commissar played a crucial role in educating the party members.
meanings.sent2: The commissars worked tirelessly to ensure the party's organization ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The commissars decided to teach political education through a game of charades - it was a hit!
meanings.sent4: The commissars were the gears that kept the party's engine running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The commissars' passion for political education was contagious among the members.

meanings.definition: A person in a position of authority in a Communist party.
meanings.sent1: The commissars made important decisions for the party's future.
meanings.sent2: In the Communist party, the commissars held significant authority.
meanings.sent3: The commissars decided to have a silly hat competition to assert their authority - it lightened the mood!
meanings.sent4: The commissars were the pillars of authority within the party.
meanings.sent5: The commissars' authority was unquestioned among the party members.
